intro: Ciconium zonale, commonly known as the zoned ciconium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive zonation pattern. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on short peduncles. Its roots are tuberous and have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Ciconium zonale is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
